author: Dianne Bourne
title: Shrek the musical is coming BACK to Manchester - here's how to get tickets - Manchester Evening News
text:
Hit musical Wicked is flying back to Manchester's Palace Theatre 
The larger-than-life production, which features spectacular stage sets, costumes, and even THAT dragon, will once again be directed by Nigel Harman, who starred in the original West End production as Lord Farquaad. 
It follows unlikely hero Shrek and his loyal steed Donkey as they embark on a quest to rescue the beautiful (if slightly temperamental) Princess Fiona from a fire-breathing, love-sick dragon. 
Add the diminutive Lord Farquaad (worth the ticket price alone), a gang of fairytale misfits and a biscuit with attitude, and you’ve got the biggest, brightest musical comedy around. Nigel Harman as Lord Farquaad in Shrek - he is now directing the musical 
Nigel said: “I had so much fun directing the original UK and Ireland Tour that I jumped at the chance to work on it again. Shrek the Musical has created pivotal moments in my career – firstly winning an Olivier and then my directorial debut. It’s certainly become one of the classic family musicals of all time and I’m really proud to be a part of it.” Read More Wicked in Manchester: 10 more musicals we want to see at the city's theatres 
Producers Caro Newling and Nick Salmon said: “Following the huge success of the first UK and Ireland tour, we are delighted that Shrek the Musical is returning Manchester in 2018. It was a joy bringing this much-loved story to cities across the country, and now, three years on and after much demand for its return, we are thrilled to be giving audiences another chance to experience the loveable green ogre, Princess Fiona, Donkey and all their fairy-tale friends live on stage.” Shrek the Musical is coming back to Manchester (Photo: Publicity pic) Read More 
Our reviewers loved the show, giving it five stars on the previous tour , hailing it: “A perfect mixture of music, dance and performance comedy, with a sprinkling of fresh gags and slightly risqué humour to keep adults on their toes.” Shrek the musical is heading back to Manchester (Photo: Publicity pic) How to get tickets 
Priority booking for Shrek opens today, February 23, before general bookings open tomorrow, Friday February 24. 
Shows are available from Tuesday January 16 - Sunday January 28, 2018. 
Tickets can be purchased at www.atgtickets.com/manchester or telephone 0844 871 3019 Like us on Facebook
